snippet: Whoever becomes commissioner will take over as the Police Department has drastically reduced the number of times officers have stopped and frisked people on the street.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes that whoever becomes New York Police Department's next commissioner will take over as the department has drastically reduced the number of times officers have stopped and frisked people on the street; suggests that fact may be good news for William J Bratton, who is on Bill de Blasio's short list of candidates for the job.
lead_paragraph: Whoever becomes commissioner will take over as the Police Department has drastically reduced the number of times officers have stopped and frisked people on the street.

headline.main: In Policing Tactic’s Decline, Gift to Next Commissioner
headline.print_headline: In Policing Tactic’s Decline, Gift to Next Commissioner
